name: Timeline analysis
description: The process of moving from a set of timeline entries to reconstructed events, or to identify times of interest (adapted from Breitinger et al. 2025).
details: This can involve refinement approaches such as: filtering irrelevant entries, highlighting key entries, or aggregating entries into more meaningful events
references: Breitinger, F., Studiawan, H. and Hargreaves, C., 2025. SoK: Timeline based event reconstruction for digital forensics: Terminology, methodology, and current challenges.
Casey, E., 2011. Digital evidence and computer crime: Forensic science, computers, and the internet. Academic press, Section 8.1.2
Hargreaves, C. and Patterson, J., 2012. An automated timeline reconstruction approach for digital forensic investigations. Digital Investigation, 9, pp.S69-S79.
